intro: Tetrapterys mucronata subsp. eumucronata, commonly known as the narrow-tipped acanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
